page.title: 11Customs Hand ba' in Jedburgh
page.content: Ba'day is held on Fastern's E'en (the day before Lent).The game is played between the Uppies born above the Mercat Cross,and the Doonies born below it.The game is played with a ball of leather filled with sawdust or damp straw and has three ribbons attached .To hail (score) the Uppies have to get the ball over the castle wall and the Doonies score at the bottom of the town.The shops'windows are boarded up for protection as the game is played in the streets.To start the game the ball is thrown up in the air. Everybody jumps to try to get it There are no rules and the game is very rough.
